because the file is not in your home directory, it is in $HOME/Desktop
you do have no such file.  because it isn't in the directory where your command line starts.
so do this:   cd Desktop

not desktop, Desktop.   you have to type the correct things.
to save typing, you could have done this:    cd De<tab>
the tab key will complete the word for you, in this case Desktop
it will give you a new prompt on a new line.  you can check that it worked by doing this:   ls -l
that will list all files in the directory, in long format.  the x in the beginning of the line means executable
